definition: to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]

sentences.english: The bus driver chews his sandwich and watches us in the overhead mirror.
sentences.chinese: 司機一邊從後視鏡裏看戲一邊嚼着三明治。

sentences.english: He buy her trinket and take her to the theater.
sentences.chinese: 他給她購買小裝飾品並帶她去看戲。

sentences.english: Will your parents let you come to the theatre with us?
sentences.chinese: 你的父母會讓你同我們一起去看戲嗎？

sentences.english: Mr. Tilney was no fonder of the play than the pump-room.
sentences.chinese: 蒂爾尼先生看戲的興趣，並不比去礦泉廳的興趣大。

sentences.english: Let's eat first and go to the theater afterwards.
sentences.chinese: 咱們先去喫飯，然後再去看戲。

sentences.english: Did you go to theater last night?
I wonder if you care for an opera?
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你喜不喜歡看戲？

sentences.english: I hate to sit there and look at the same stage scenery one scene after another.
sentences.chinese: 我看戲最討厭一幕接一幕合用一個佈景。

sentences.english: So I can study Peking Opera and spend a lot of time in the theater.
sentences.chinese: 這樣我就可以學京劇，並且花很多時間看戲了。

sentences.english: This class, who have got tickets, will go to the theatre this morning.
sentences.chinese: 這個班都拿到了票，今天晚上去看戲。

sentences.english: He returned two tickets, as Jack and Tom were too busy and they couldn't go to the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 他退了兩張票，因爲傑克和湯姆太忙了，不能去看戲。

sentences.english: We all went to the theatre except John; he remained at home.
sentences.chinese: 除了約翰，我們都去看戲了，他留在家裏。

sentences.english: We   go to the theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我們今晚可能會去劇院看戲。

sentences.english: I hate to sit there and look at the same stage scenery one act after another .
sentences.chinese: 我看戲最討厭一幕接一幕合用一個佈景。

sentences.english: We can only hang out together.
And compared to the other years, I have got much less time to drama and peking opera.
sentences.chinese: 發現和前幾年相比，很少很少看戲聽戲了。

definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to stand in a circle and watch
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
spectator/non-participant
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
important/urgent
it doesn't matter
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
from start to finish/from head to tail/the whole (thing)
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
